en: He looks like your brother.
Leave it alone!
This is your responsibility. It's not the kind of thing you can laugh off.
ko: 이건 네 책임이야. 그냥 웃으면서 넘길 일이 아니라고.

en: She sets your world alight.
You are soul needs rescue.
Your soul has been condemned to hell.
Your soul needs rescue.
Your behavior brought disgrace on our family.
ko: 네 행동 때문에 우리 집안 망신 다 시켰어.

en: Your heart's beating, alive and beating.
You have caused me to lose my temper.
This is your fault.
You are two-faced.
I can wait for you.
I will make a new suit for you.
ko: 내가 너한테 새 정장 하나 맞춰줄게.

en: I'm quite out of patience with you.
ko: 나 이제 더 이상은 못 참겠어.

en: You shall have my car.
I'm counting on you.
I'm no match for you.
Can't you hear the sound?
I know you don't care.
ko: 너 별로 신경 안 쓰는 거 알아.

en: I've got no time to sit and talk.
I know you can make it better.
ko: 네가 더 잘할 수 있을 거라 믿어.

en: I know you can make it.
ko: 네가 해낼 수 있을 거란 거 알아.

en: Where were you loafing?
It seems you and I are essential to this project. We'd better get along or it'll go badly.
ko: 우리 둘 다 이 프로젝트에 꼭 필요해. 잘 지내보는 게 좋을 거야, 안 그러면 골치 아파질 테니까.

en: You noisy children will be chucked off by the driver.
ko: 너희들 시끄럽게 굴면 기사 아저씨가 내쫓을 거야.

en: I saw the picture you took of that fish.
You just made me miss the perfect shot when you hollered.
ko: 네가 소리 지르는 바람에 결정적인 장면을 놓쳤잖아.

en: If you act like a child, you will be treated as such.
That's my own affair.
You are wrong.
There's no need for you to butt in. Just let him do this on his own.
ko: 네가 끼어들 필요 없어. 그냥 혼자 하게 내버려 둬.

en: You talk so fast I can't understand a word you say.
ko: 너 말이 너무 빨라서 무슨 소린지 하나도 못 알아듣겠어.

en: You are drunk!
You're overworked.
You should go ahead and do it, just like you said you would.
You should have seen yourself, yawning all through the meeting.
ko: 회의 내내 하품만 해대던 네 꼴을 봤어야 됐는데.

en: Good-bye!
You're out of it.
It's in the overhead compartment.
We'll call you when your table is ready.
What are you planning to do for the New Year vacation?
I am greatly indebted to you for all you have done for me.
ko: 그동안 도와준 거 정말 고마워, 신세 많이 졌네.

en: I really appreciate your kindness.
It has always been a pleasure to work with you.
There is nothing to be gained by flattery.
Complimenting is lying.
Beware of smooth talk.
Could you bring me some water?
Can I have some water, please?
Could I get some water, please?
May I have a glass of water?
Just water, please.
The rights you requested do not belong to us.
May I have the honor of asking you?
I'd like a doll, a new bicycle.....and peace on earth!
ko: 인형이랑 새 자전거... 그리고 지구의 평화를 원해요!

en: No gratuity accepted.
Thank you again for your good thoughts.
Thanks so much for your good thoughts.
I'm very grateful for your sympathy.
This way, please, mademoiselle.
What's your daughter's name?
Your daughter passed the examination, I hear.
I ask to see your daughter.
Would you like a ride?
It was kind of you to invite us.
Thank you very much for your invitation.
What size do you wear?
This accident has nothing to do with me, officer.
ko: 경찰관님, 이 사고는 저랑 아무 상관 없어요.

en: Here comes a copper!
I am pleased at your coming.
Let's have sushi.
You can't drive. You've been drinking.
It was gracious of you to accept.
Can I drink alcohol?
Let's have sake.
As he was drinking he got very merry and kept telling everybody just how much he hated hospitals.
ko: 그는 술을 마시면서 기분이 좋아지더니, 병원이 얼마나 싫은지 계속 떠들어댔어요.

en: No drinkers.
Liquor will have an effect on a person.
The minute I have something to drink, I turn bright red.
ko: 전 술 한 잔만 마셔도 얼굴이 바로 빨개져요.

en: Do you drink alcohol?
Everybody has their favorite drink.
Drinking too much is bad for the health.
I can't help you. As a matter of fact, I'm very busy just now.
ko: 도와드릴 수가 없어요. 사실 지금 제가 좀 바쁘거든요.

en: Shall I help you?
I am willing to help you.
I said, "Is there anything I can do?"
I asked you if you wanted some help.
Let me help you.
The maid was dead tired of her household chores.
The maid immediately cleaned the dishes from the table.
ko: 가정부가 식탁에 있던 접시들을 바로 치웠어요.

en: The servants tried to carry out their master's order.
The maid made my bed.
It's very decent of you to help me.
I'd be very grateful if you'd help me.
Could you help me?
It's very kind of you to help me.
Thank you for your assistance.
May I use the bathroom?
Could you show me where the bathroom is?
ko: 화장실 어디 있는지 알려줄 수 있어?

en: May I trouble you to pass me the salt?
I'm sorry to bother you.
I'm at a complete loss!
Don't be too hard on me, please.
I am in receipt of your letter.
Thank you very much for your letter.
I hereby beg to acknowledge your letter.
I acknowledged the receipt of your letter.
I received your letter.
I am looking forward to your letter.
Your letter reached me only today, having been delayed by the heavy snow.
ko: 폭설 때문에 늦어져서 네 편지를 오늘에서야 받았어.

en: Thank you for writing.
Thank you for your letter.
You're my good omen.
Thank you for your business.
Would you like me to order it?
A young person wants to see you.
I am sorry if I disturbed you.
I hope I'm not disturbing you.
Thank you very much for your hospitality.
I'm sorry to disturb you, but there's a phone call for you.
I'm sorry to bother you, but I would like to ask you a favor.
ko: 귀찮게 해서 미안한데, 부탁 하나만 해도 될까?

en: Stop putting on an act.
Do you like the theater?
The custom of bowing is peculiar to the islanders.
ko: 절하는 관습은 그 섬 사람들만의 독특한 문화야.

en: Do you have a few minutes to spare?
ko: 잠깐 시간 좀 낼 수 있어?

en: I am sorry to have taken up your valuable time.
Do you have the time?
Please come and see me if you have time.
Do you have some time?
Is it to go?
Have mercy on me and spare my life, please!
With reference to the invoice No.56789 which was due last month, we have not yet received your remittance.
ko: 지난달까지 냈어야 할 56789번 청구서 대금이 아직 안 들어왔어.

en: How would you like to pay?
How would you like to pay for it?
We remind you that our terms are 60 days net.
May we therefore ask you for a two months' extension of credit?
ko: 지불 기한을 두 달만 더 늘려줄 수 있을까?

en: Your payment is now two months overdue.
Bring your children with you.
I'm sure the children are getting big.
Is the kid still up?
You should build a fire under the kid.
How old are your children?
How are you and your wife doing, now that the birds have all flown the coop?
ko: 애들 다 독립시켰는데, 아내랑은 요즘 어떻게 지내?

en: May his life be blessed with health and happiness all through.
ko: 그 사람의 삶에 건강과 행복이 가득하길 빌어.

en: Do you have any children?
Please let me pick up your sister at the station.
ko: 내가 역으로 네 여동생 마중 나갈게.

en: I feel very sorry for your sister.
Will you give my best regards to your sister?
Will you go out on an errand?
I regret to say I can't come.
ko: 미안하지만 나 못 갈 것 같아.

en: How is your work getting along?
Please wash the dishes.
Would you put the dishes in the sink?
Eat everything on your plate, or you won't get any dessert.
ko: 남기지 말고 다 먹어, 안 그러면 디저트 없어.

en: You'd better eat everything that's on your plate.
ko: 접시에 있는 거 다 먹는 게 좋을 거야.

en: I'd like to go to Takayama during festival time.
The date of the festival coincides with that of the exam.
I greatly appreciate your efforts during our festival.
ko: 축제 기간에 고생해 줘서 정말 고마워.

en: Sending year-end gifts is one of the customs peculiar to Japan.
ko: 연말 선물을 보내는 건 일본 특유의 풍습 중 하나야.

en: Do you want to sit down?
Pass the sugar, please.
I will help you if you are in trouble.
I'd be happy to help you if you're having trouble.
Behave yourself.
What language do you speak in your country?
Behave yourself, and you'll get something nice.
ko: 말 잘 들으면 좋은 거 줄게.

en: Where are your manners?
What about your manners!
Watch yourself.
I hope you'll be happy forever.
My clothes have an oily smell because I ate at an okonomiyaki place.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
You may call on me whenever you like.
Whatever you like.
Help yourself to whatever you like.
Please help yourself to any food you like.
Sit wherever you like.
Have a satsuma for dessert.
Well, do you like it?
OK, so that's it for me. Now I'll hand things over to the next speaker.
ko: 자, 내 얘기는 여기까지고 이제 다음 사람한테 넘길게.

en: We solved the problem by mutual concessions.
The chemistry is right for us.
Don't you get on each other's nerves?
They are bitter enemies.
Let's try to understand one another.
There must be a better person for both of us.
ko: 우리 둘 다에게 더 좋은 사람이 있을 거야.

en: Let's stop finding fault with each other.
ko: 서로 꼬투리 잡는 것 좀 그만하자.

en: Let's keep in touch with each other.
To understand each other is important.
Let's agree to share in the profits.
Can we effect a compromise?
So there's no love lost between them then?
ko: 둘이 사이가 아주 안 좋은가 보네?

en: It is our duty to help one another.
I don't like families that quarrel amongst themselves.
It seems we are in the same boat.
Find mutual interests, and you will get along with each other.
ko: 공통 관심사를 찾아봐, 그럼 금방 친해질 거야.

en: You called?
What's the name of the party you're calling?
I will bear your words in mind.
If you insist, I'll have another drink.
ko: 정 그러시다면 한 잔 더 할게요.

en: I will borrow it then, if you insist.
How have you been?
I hope this letter finds you well.
ko: 이 편지가 닿을 때쯤 잘 지내고 계시면 좋겠네요.

en: Good luck to you!
Thank you for coming.
It's so kind of you to come to see me off.
It's nice of you to see me off.
Good show!
I'm sure people ask you this question all the time, but it's all that comes to mind right now.
ko: 다들 많이 물어보는 질문이겠지만 지금은 이것밖에 생각이 안 나네요.

en: Here they come.
Do you want the doctors to use the machine to make your brother breathe?
ko: 동생분이 인공호흡기로 숨을 쉬게 하고 싶으세요?

en: Can your brother drive a car?
Compared with his brother, he is a poor athlete.
Your brother got married, didn't he?
He wants the money.
For people who dislike the idea of giving money, a gift certificate is a good idea.
ko: 현금 주는 걸 싫어하는 분들에겐 상품권이 좋죠.

en: I can't lend you any money.
I will do that work on condition that I get paid for it.
ko: 보수를 받는 조건으로 그 일을 할게요.

en: I caught a pickpocket dead to rights when he stole my money.
ko: 소매치기가 제 돈을 훔치는 걸 현장에서 딱 잡았어요.

en: It is wrong to steal money.
My money was stolen.
I'm trying to save money.
Can you save enough money for the down payment?
ko: 계약금 낼 만큼 돈을 모을 수 있겠어요?

en: I can't lend you money, because I don't have any myself.
Would you lend me some money?
All the money spent, we started looking for work.
ko: 돈을 다 써버려서 일자리를 알아보기 시작했어요.

en: All the money put together still won't be enough.
Should I insert coins first?
Will you lend me some money?
I have got some money.
Give me a little money.
We should not make too much of money.
ko: 돈을 너무 중요하게 생각하면 안 돼요.

en: It is against my principles to borrow money.
ko: 돈을 빌리는 건 제 원칙에 어긋나요.

en: Is it possible to borrow money?
I ran all over town trying to borrow some money.
ko: 돈을 빌리려고 온 동네를 다 돌아다녔어요.

en: People with money were able to buy butter.
ko: 돈 있는 사람들은 버터를 살 수 있었어요.

en: You may spend or save at will.
Spending money is as easy as pie.
ko: 돈 쓰는 건 정말 식은 죽 먹기예요.

en: I wish I had more money with me.
ko: 돈을 더 가지고 있었으면 좋았을 텐데.

en: With all his money, he is not happy.
ko: 그렇게 돈이 많은데도 그는 행복하지 않아요.

en: You had better not waste your money.
ko: 돈을 낭비하지 않는 게 좋을 거예요.

en: I have a lot of money.
Please leave some money.
If you have any money, please lend me some.
Can I borrow some money from you?
It goes without saying that health is above wealth.
ko: 건강이 재산보다 중요하다는 건 말할 것도 없죠.

en: I don't have much money, but I can get along somehow.
ko: 돈은 별로 없지만 어떻게든 살 수 있어요.

en: I'll give you back the money tomorrow.
Lend money only to such as will repay it.
Money is used for buying or selling goods, measuring value and storing wealth.
ko: 돈은 물건을 사고팔거나 가치를 매기고 재산을 모으는 데 쓰여.

en: You should be careful of your money.
The money amounts to almost two thousands dollars.
You must make good use of money.
You cannot substitute money for health.
Money will do anything.
You should turn money to good use.
I have hardly any money left.
There was scarcely any money left.
How much money do you have?
I have little money. However, I feel happy with you.
ko: 돈은 별로 없지만 너랑 같이 있어서 행복해.

en: Money answers all things.
I do not want any money.
How much money do you have with you?
I'm not worried about the price.
Money takes a long time to earn, but you can spend it in no time.
ko: 돈은 버는 데는 한참 걸리지만 쓰는 건 순식간이야.

en: How would you like them?
Do you have much money with you?
If you have any money with you, please lend me some.
ko: 돈 좀 있으면 나 좀 빌려줘.

en: Do you have any money with you?
She is exact in money matters.
Can you imagine the world without money?
ko: 돈 없는 세상을 상상할 수 있어?

en: Some people write books for money, others for pleasure.
ko: 어떤 사람들은 돈 벌려고 책을 쓰고, 어떤 사람들은 즐거워서 써.

en: If she continues to live with a man she doesn't love for his money, the day will come when she will be utterly frustrated and between the devil and the deep blue sea.
ko: 사랑하지도 않는 남자랑 돈 때문에 계속 살다 보면, 결국 완전히 좌절하고 진퇴양난에 빠지는 날이 올 거야.

en: I'll try Jane for some money.
Stop arguing about money.
Money counts for little.
Money, as such, has no meaning.
ko: 돈 그 자체로는 아무 의미가 없어.

en: Moving money and technology from one side of the globe to the other is not enough.
ko: 돈이랑 기술을 지구 이쪽에서 저쪽으로 옮기는 것만으론 부족해.

en: I want money.
Since we have no money, it's no use thinking of a holiday.
ko: 돈이 없으니까 휴가 갈 생각은 해봤자 소용없어.

en: If you need money, I'll lend you some.
Love is as important to me as money is to her.
ko: 걔한테 돈이 중요한 만큼 나한테는 사랑이 중요해.

en: Do you need much money?
Money has changed his life.
I am running short of money.
Lack of money brought my travel plans to an end.
I can't do it for want of money.
If I had enough money, I could buy this book.
ko: 돈만 충분했으면 이 책을 샀을 텐데.

en: It is generally believed that money brings happiness.
I have run short of money.
Our money ran out.
I can't buy it for lack for money.
We could not continue our journey for lack of money.
ko: 돈이 부족해서 여행을 계속할 수 없었어.

en: It goes without saying that money is not everything.
ko: 돈이 전부는 아니라는 건 말할 필요도 없지.

en: If you need some money, why don't you borrow some from your mother?
ko: 돈이 좀 필요하면 엄마한테 좀 빌려보는 건 어때?

en: You can withdraw some money out of the bank, if you need any.
ko: 돈 필요하면 은행에서 좀 찾아도 돼.

en: The idea that money can buy everything is wrong.
ko: 돈으로 모든 걸 살 수 있다는 생각은 틀렸어.

en: Had I had enough money, I would have bought that computer.
ko: 돈만 충분했으면 그 컴퓨터 샀을 거야.

en: Now that I have enough money, I can get that camera.
ko: 이제 돈 다 모아서 그 카메라 살 수 있어요.

en: I'm very happy to make your acquaintance.
I'm glad to know you.
If you are not in a hurry, please stay a little longer.
ko: 안 바쁘시면 좀 더 있다 가세요.

en: How about cup of tea or something, if you aren't in a hurry?
How was your holiday?
The holiday was up very quickly.
Good night and sweet dreams.
We have a parking lot for the customers.
You mustn't keep your guest waiting outside.
ko: 손님을 밖에서 기다리게 하면 안 되죠.

en: What about you? Will you have orange juice, too?
The visitor has gone away five minutes before you came back.
Have all the passengers got on board yet?
Our guests should be here within an hour.
ko: 한 시간 안에 손님들이 오실 거예요.

en: Is there a doctor in the house?
Earning our customers confidence and respect is this firm's objective.
ko: 고객의 신뢰와 존중을 얻는 게 우리 회사의 목표예요.

en: Please write down your home address.
We are trying to clarify your future procurement requirements.
ko: 앞으로 필요한 게 뭔지 확인해 보려고요.

en: We aim to please.
Could I ask you to get a cup of tea for our guest?
ko: 손님한테 차 한잔만 갖다 줄 수 있어요?

en: Sir, you have left your lighter on the table.
We have to take great pains to make our guests feel comfortable.
ko: 손님들이 편하게 계실 수 있도록 정말 신경 많이 써야 해요.

en: Our guests have arrived.
I'm sorry, sir, but a jacket and tie are required.
The guests were waited on by a highly trained team of young staff.
ko: 잘 훈련된 젊은 직원들이 손님들을 모셨어요.

en: The customers were made to wait outside in the rain for several hours.
ko: 손님들이 빗속에서 몇 시간 동안 밖에서 기다려야 했어요.

en: We must keep the customers satisfied.
The guests listened to a number of speeches.
We had no customers, so we shut the shop early.
ko: 손님이 없어서 가게 문을 일찍 닫았어요.

en: A customer came and so tea was brewed.
A customer is having his shoes shined on a slapped-together stand.
ko: 한 손님이 임시 가판대에서 구두를 닦고 있어요.

en: We sold the store for want of customers.
Did I hurt your feelings?
I am sorry for you.
I'm sorry for you.
Sorry, but you must have the wrong number.
Did I hurt your feelings? I meant no harm.
ko: 제가 상처 줬나요? 그럴 의도는 아니었어요.

en: How would you like it?
Glad you like it.
Don't forget to take your umbrella when you leave.
ko: 나갈 때 우산 챙기는 거 잊지 마세요.

en: Give me a telephone call when you get back.
Welcome home.
Will you do me a favor?
I wonder if you could do me a favor.
ko: 혹시 부탁 하나만 들어주실 수 있을까요?

en: Please be quiet for mercy's sake during the lesson.
ko: 제발 수업 중에는 조용히 좀 해 주세요.

en: Be an angel and turn the radio down.
ko: 착하지, 라디오 소리 좀 줄여 줄래?

en: For the love of Heaven, don't get angry.
Don't refer to this matter again, please.
ko: 이 얘기는 다시 꺼내지 말아 주세요.

en: For God's sake don't tell it to anyone.
Come on! Give me a chance.
